sgraph

Class GroupNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • sgraph.Nodes.AbstractNode
      • sgraph.Nodes.GroupNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INode

    public class GroupNode
extends AbstractNode
    This class represents a group node in the scenegraph. A group node is simply a logical grouping of other nodes. It can have an arbitrary number of children. Its children can be nodes of any type
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

      A list of its children

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(INode child)
      Since a group node is capable of having children, this method overrides the default one in AbstractNode and adds a child to this node
      INode clone()
      Makes a deep copy of the subtree rooted at this node
      void draw(IScenegraphRenderer context, java.util.Stack<org.joml.Matrix4f> modelView)
      To draw this node, it simply delegates to all its children
      java.util.List<INode> getChildren()
      Get a list of all its children, for convenience purposes
      INode getNode(java.lang.String name)
      Searches recursively into its subtree to look for node with specified name.
      void setScenegraph(IScenegraph graph)
      Sets the reference to the scene graph object for this node, and then recurses down to children for the same

        public void setScenegraph(IScenegraph graph)

      • draw

        public void draw(IScenegraphRenderer context,
